newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end down as yen continues to rise.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end down as yen continues to rise.

text.p: Tokyo stocks dropped on Wednesday, due to worries that the yen's recent rally against the dollar may continue and hurt the competitiveness of export-oriented issues, brokers said.
The Nikkei average shed 242.62 points or 1.18 percent to finish at 20,289.93, just above the session low of 20,282.43. The Nikkei's June futures closed 290 points lower at 20,310.
"When the dollar slipped through 111 yen again, that fuelled worries about the yen's strength ahead of the Denver (G7) summit," said a senior broker at a "Big Four" securities house.
